titles: A verry merry vvherry-ferry-voyage: or Yorke for my money sometimes perilous, sometimes quarrellous, performed with a paire of oares, by sea from London, by Iohn Taylor, and Iob Pennell. And written by I.T.
author: Taylor, John, 1580-1653.
notes: Running title reads: A very merry wherry-ferry-voyage.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: Rivers --  England --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
England --  Description and travel --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
